paragraphs: I'm an undergraduate physics student at UC Berkeley. My current research focuses on condensed matter physics, specifically on scanning tunneling microscopy and graphenes.

Beyond research, I'm passionate about scientific communication and making physics accessible to broader audiences. I believe that the beauty of physics lies in its power to reveal the hidden order of nature.

projects.title: Heat Diffusion in Space-varying Heat Diffusivity Materials
projects.description: Created a baseline for evaluating the stability of explicit vs. implicit methods in solving the 2D heat equation in space-varying heat diffusivity materials.

experience.title: Undergraduate Researcher
responsibilities: Scanning Tunneling Microscopy and its applications on graphenes.
